definitions.definition: In an expression involving division , the number by which another number is being divided .
An integer that divides another integer an integral number of times, the former being called a divisor of the latter.
examples: 10 is a divisor of 100, but not of 101.
The positive divisors of 6 are 1, 2, 3 and 6.

subdefinitions.definition: A ring element which can be multiplied (by some other ring element) to yield a third ring element, the first being called a divisor of the third. If the ring is noncommutative , then one specifies whether a divisor is left , right , or two-sided .

definitions.definition: Any of several kinds of formal object associated to an algebraic variety , scheme , etc., which play a role similar to that of homology or cohomology groups in the study of topological spaces .

subdefinitions.definition: An element of the free abelian group on the points of the space.
labels: in the study of Riemann surfaces
subdefinitions.label_groups: in the study of Riemann surfaces

subdefinitions.definition: ) A Weil divisor : an element of the free abelian group on the codimension -1 subvarieties (or subschemes).
labels: on a variety (or integral locally Noetherian scheme
subdefinitions.label_groups: on a variety (or integral locally Noetherian scheme

subdefinitions.definition: ) A Cartier divisor ; see Cartier divisors on  Wikipedia. Wikipedia
labels: on a variety (or integral Noetherian scheme
subdefinitions.label_groups: on a variety (or integral Noetherian scheme

main_definition: ( arithmetic ) In an expression involving division , the number by which another number is being divided .
secondary_definitions: An integer that divides another integer an integral number of times, the former being called a divisor of the latter.

( mathematics , algebraic geometry ) Any of several kinds of formal object associated to an algebraic variety , scheme , etc., which play a role similar to that of homology or cohomology groups in the study of topological spaces .
